titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: The Delaware Section of the American Chemical Society was organized in the fall of 1917, with the DuPont Experimental Station Chemical Society as a nucleus. The first officers of the Section were Lammot du Pont, as Chairman; R. P. Calvert, as Secretary; and C. M. A. Stine and Firman Thompson, as Councilors. The charter for the Section, received from the American Chemical Society on December 28, 1917, embraced the territory of Delaware and Salem County, New Jersey. The South Jersey members petitioned for withdrawal in March 1920, and the petition was accepted, since it was impractical for them to attend meetings in Wilmington.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of bound (1944-1998) and unbound issues (2005-2007) of the Del-Chem Bulletin, the newsletter of the Delaware section of the American Chemical Society.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Chemical Heritage Foundation: Herman Skolnik papers.
